text:
Morning, #2 would probably be accurate. The previous computer was backed up and
a bare metal restore to a new SSD/computer combo using Veeam. It's possible
that the original device did not have it but from what a few people have noted
here, if cloning, the recovery partition isn't needed necessarily. 
Or the backup process did not back up the recovery partition for some reason. 
Just Uefi partition and c: 
Thanks for the responses and additional discussion. 
This is a great group and a great resource! 
Jim 
[cid:McAndrews-Logo_b981f23b-af61-4e79-9eb1-f721417fba3e.PNG]

Jim Boettger
Manager, Information Technology Group
McAndrews, Held & Malloy, Ltd.
500 W. Madison St., 34th floor | Chicago, IL 60661
P: 312-775-8000 

website

_

metadata.subject: Re: [patchmanagement] Feedback to Microsoft
metadata.email_text_original:
You don't often get email from jboettger@mcandrews-ip.com. Learn why this is
important [https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
Morning, #2 would probably be accurate.  The previous computer was backed up and
a bare metal restore to a new SSD/computer combo using Veeam.  It's possible
that the original device did not have it but from what a few people have noted
here, if cloning, the recovery partition isn't needed necessarily. 
Or the backup process did not back up the recovery partition for some reason. 
Just Uefi partition and c: 
Thanks for the responses and additional discussion.
